[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: batch_statements()] [Linear Combinations] Can an attacker exploit linear relationships between batch statements to forge signatures that verify in batch but not individually? (HIGH)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Discrete Log] Does verify() rely on the hardness of discrete logarithm in the specific Ciphersuite group, or could weak groups enable signature forgery? (HIGH)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: sign()] [Fault Attacks] Can hardware fault injection during scalar multiplication cause incorrect signatures that leak private key information? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Bitcoin Taproot] When verifying Taproot spend signatures, does the implementation correctly handle BIP340 tagged hashes and implicit Y-coordinate? (HIGH)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Monero RingCT] For Monero integration, can the Schnorr verification be confused with Monero's MLSAG signatures, enabling forgery? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: sign()] [Ethereum EIP-191] Does signing for Ethereum messages use EIP-191 prefixing, or can signature replay occur across Ethereum and Serai contexts? (HIGH)
[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [UTXO Tracking] For Bitcoin UTXO management, can signatures be replayed to spend the same UTXO multiple times during rotation? (CRITICAL)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: sign()] [Gas Limits] For Ethereum transactions, does the signature bind to gas limits, or can transaction failure through gas manipulation be exploited? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Signature Length] Does the code validate signature length during deserialization, or can variable-length signatures cause parser confusion? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: sign()] [Concurrent Signing] Can multiple threads call sign() with the same private_key concurrently, and could race conditions leak nonce correlations? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: read()] [Malformed Input] Does read() properly handle EOF and malformed input without panicking, or could malicious signature data crash validators? (MEDIUM)
[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: write()] [Write Failure] If write() fails mid-operation, does this leave partial signature data that could be misinterpreted? (LOW)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Struct: SchnorrSignature] [Copy Trait] Does the Copy trait on SchnorrSignature enable accidental duplication of sensitive signature data that should be move-only? (LOW)
[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: sign()] [Private Key Type] Should private_key be a Zeroizing wrapper at the type level, or can non-zeroizing types be passed, leaking keys? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Public Key Validation] Does verify() assume the public_key is already validated, or should it perform on-curve and subgroup checks? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: batch_verify()] [Generic ID Type] The id parameter is generic with Copy + Zeroize bounds - can this lead to ID collisions or type confusion in batch verification? (LOW)
[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: sign()] [Challenge Type] Should challenge be a newtype wrapper to prevent accidental misuse, rather than a raw C::F? (LOW)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Struct: SchnorrSignature] [Serialization Format] Is the serialization format (R || s) standardized and compatible with external tools, or could format mismatches cause integration issues? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Runtime Execution] When verify() is called in Substrate runtime, does it consume deterministic gas/weight, or could variable costs enable DoS? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: read()] [Extrinsic Validation] During extrinsic validation in the runtime, can malformed signatures cause validation to panic and halt block production? (HIGH)
[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Storage Bloat] Can an attacker submit many invalid signatures to bloat storage with failed verification attempts? (LOW)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: batch_verify()] [Block Validation] When validating entire blocks with batched signatures, can one invalid signature in the batch cause the entire block to be rejected? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: serialize()] [SCALE Compatibility] Is the signature serialization compatible with Substrate's SCALE codec, or could encoding mismatches cause runtime errors? (MEDIUM)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: verify()] [Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use] Between signature verification and instruction execution, can state changes invalidate the verified signature's authorization? (HIGH)

[File: serai/crypto/schnorr/src/lib.rs] [Function: sign()] [Rollback Attacks] If a validator signs a transaction that later gets rolled back, can the signature be replayed in a different context? (MEDIUM)
